notesStmt.note: A number of leaves are missing, folios 41 and 115 are mutilated.

Marginal note of the owner on folio 122r. Musa ibn Sulaiman ʻIraḳi, inscribed with his name on folio 2r, attesting that the manuscript is a property of ʻImrān: מוסי אבן סלימאן עראקי יצו' אן אלכתאב חק עמראן יצו'.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pentateuch and the Former Prophets, provided with vowel-points and accents.

msItem.title: Torah u-neviʼim rishonim תורה ונביאים ראשונים

supportDesc.foliation: The Hebrew foliation shows that the first extant leaf was originally the 17th.

collation.p: 27 extant quires mostly of 8 leaves, but the codex is missing 16 pages at the beginning and several pages throughout the manuscript. Quires are marked with catchwords on the last page of the quire.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script with supralinear punctuation, probably of the 14th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Nic. Mavrocordato: purchased by the British Museum from him on 08 October 1881 ([216v]).
